description: Allows you to manage an Azure SQL Elastic Pool via the `2017-10-01-preview` API which allows for `vCore` and `DTU` based configurations.

MaxCapacity.description: The maximum capacity any one database can consume.

MinCapacity.description: The minimum capacity all databases are guaranteed.

Capacity.description: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units. For more information see the documentation for your Elasticpool configuration: [vCore-based](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/sql-database-vcore-resource-limits-elastic-pools) or [DTU-based](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/sql-database-dtu-resource-limits-elastic-pools).

Name.description: Specifies the SKU Name for this Elasticpool. The name of the SKU, will be either `vCore` based `tier` + `family` pattern (e.g. GP_Gen4, BC_Gen5) or the `DTU` based `BasicPool`, `StandardPool`, or `PremiumPool` pattern.

Tier.description: The tier of the particular SKU. Possible values are `GeneralPurpose`, `BusinessCritical`, `Basic`, `Standard`, or `Premium`. For more information see the documentation for your Elasticpool configuration: [vCore-based](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/sql-database-vcore-resource-limits-elastic-pools) or [DTU-based](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/sql-database-dtu-resource-limits-elastic-pools).

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

MaxSizeBytes.description: The max data size of the elastic pool in bytes. Conflicts with `max_size_gb`.

MaxSizeGb.description: The max data size of the elastic pool in gigabytes. Conflicts with `max_size_bytes`.

Name.description: The name of the elastic pool. This needs to be globally unique. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

ResourceGroupName.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the elastic pool. This must be the same as the resource group of the underlying SQL server.

ServerName.description: The name of the SQL Server on which to create the elastic pool. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

Tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

ZoneRedundant.description: Whether or not this elastic pool is zone redundant. `tier` needs to be `Premium` for `DTU` based  or `BusinessCritical` for `vCore` based `sku`. Defaults to `false`.
